instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> audio issue <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello, I’m working on 2019 16 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> everything works fine, except speakers sounded awful, I have see this issue before , usually replacing the audio ics fixes the problem, but board I’m working on for past 2 days in between work now has no sound at all now, no sound issue started after replacing <CHIP>U6520</CHIP>, went from popping to no sound at all,  inhave reballed and replaced <CHIP>U6520</CHIP> 3 times, <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> twice and <CHIP>U6560</CHIP> once, all 3 chips on left side have been  replaced chips were pulled from logicboard with no sound issue, donor board had  sleep wake issue, but verified good audio
Anyhow I’m stumped, if I close the lid and open again I will have audio on the side that wasn’t touched yet, but sound is low, and popping sound is still present, 
Curious where to start,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> audio issue <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Donlan78, post: 96116, member: 44787"]
Hello, I’m working on 2019 16 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> everything works fine, except speakers sounded awful, I have see this issue before , usually replacing the audio ics fixes the problem, but board I’m working on for past 2 days in between work now has no sound at all now, no sound issue started after replacing <CHIP>U6520</CHIP>, went from popping to no sound at all,  inhave reballed and replaced <CHIP>U6520</CHIP> 3 times, <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> twice and <CHIP>U6560</CHIP> once, all 3 chips on left side have been  replaced chips were pulled from logicboard with no sound issue, donor board had  sleep wake issue, but verified good audio
Anyhow I’m stumped, if I close the lid and open again I will have audio on the side that wasn’t touched yet, but sound is low, and popping sound is still present,
Curious where to start,
[/QUOTE]

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is low 12.37v on <CAPACITOR>C6555</CAPACITOR> and all the plbis caps near the audio ics
Pretty’s sure this is the problem, and it’s obvious something. Is dragging it down 
Just not sure how to find the fault in this situation 
Don’t  think I can inject voltage to see what’s warm, 

Any suggestion would be great, client is supposed to pick up Thursday, I’m not sure how I missed  the audio popping originally, but it is what it is, I have a much bigger problem now  (functional  but no sound)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> audio issue <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What said the client about how the problem appeared?
Check <SIGNAL>ANGLE_SENSOR_ND</SIGNAL>/MGL and <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN_SMC_IN</SIGNAL>, when lid is closed/open.

BTW, write directly into reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
I don't see a reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

bedudes the lid sensor is there away to test which audio ic is failing 

the macbook works perfect other than popping sound when playing video,the no sound tilllidnis closed and opened only fixes sound in the left side speakers, the right side have no sound at all
